metadata.feature_description: Lock content to prevent concurrent editing by multiple users

observations: Code analysis reveals that Content Locking feature is PLANNED but NOT IMPLEMENTED in the HTMLPro module.
Resource strings for 'Lock Content' (Lock.Action) and 'Unlock Content' (Unlock.Action) exist in SharedResources.resx, indicating the feature was planned.
A 'ContentLocked.Error' message exists: 'This content has been locked by [USER]. You cannot save your changes unless the lock is released first.'
EditHtml.ascx contains a TODO comment on line 67: '// TODO: Disable edit tab when locked by other user: var options = { disabled: [0] };' - confirming the feature was never completed.
No Lock/Unlock API endpoints exist in HtmlTextProController.cs or HtmlTextController.cs.
UI verification confirmed: The Module Actions menu shows Settings, Export Content, Import Content, Help, Develop, Delete, and Refresh - but NO 'Lock Content' or 'Unlock Content' options exist.
The suggested UI location 'Module Actions > Edit Content > Lock/Unlock' does not exist in the current implementation.

Per testing instructions: Since this feature exists in code planning (resource strings) but has no UI element to test, no test scenarios can be executed. This is documented as an observation rather than a test failure.

summary.pass_rate: N/A - Feature not implemented in UI
